title: Integers & Rational Numbers
description: Master integer operations and rational number representations with comprehensive practice
description_zh: 通过全面练习掌握整数运算和有理数表示
objectives: Understand positive and negative integers and their real-world applications
Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division with integers
Represent rational numbers on the number line accurately
Convert fluently between fractions, decimals and percentages
Compare and order rational numbers of different forms
objectives_zh: 理解正整数和负整数及其实际应用
执行整数的加减乘除运算
准确地在数轴上表示有理数
流利地在分数、小数和百分数之间转换

sections.title: Introduction to Integers
sections.content: Integers are the set of whole numbers including positive numbers (1, 2, 3, ...), negative numbers (-1, -2, -3, ...), and zero. They extend our number system to represent quantities below zero. Real-world examples: temperatures below freezing (-5°C), debt ($-200), floors below ground level (B3), and points lost in a game (-10 points). The symbol ℤ represents the set of all integers.
sections.content_zh: 整数是包括正数(1, 2, 3, ...)、负数(-1, -2, -3, ...)和零的整数集合。它们扩展了我们的数字系统以表示零以下的数量。实际例子：冰点以下的温度(-5°C)、债务($-200)、地下楼层(B3)和游戏中失去的分数(-10分)。符号ℤ表示所有整数的集合。

sections.title: Adding Integers
sections.content:
Rules for adding integers:

1. SAME SIGNS: Add the absolute values and keep the common sign.
   • (+5) + (+3) = +8
   • (-5) + (-3) = -8

2. DIFFERENT SIGNS: Subtract the smaller absolute value from the larger, and take the sign of the number with larger absolute value.
   • (-7) + (+12) = +5 (because 12 - 7 = 5, and 12 has larger absolute value with + sign)
   • (+6) + (-10) = -4 (because 10 - 6 = 4, and 10 has larger absolute value with - sign)

Think of a number line: adding a positive number means moving right, adding a negative number means moving left from your starting position.
sections.content_zh:
整数加法规则：

1. 同号：将绝对值相加并保留公共符号。
   • (+5) + (+3) = +8
   • (-5) + (-3) = -8

2. 异号：从较大的绝对值中减去较小的，并取绝对值较大的数的符号。
   • (-7) + (+12) = +5（因为12 - 7 = 5，而12的绝对值较大且为正号）
   • (+6) + (-10) = -4（因为10 - 6 = 4，而10的绝对值较大且为负号）

想象数轴：加正数意味着向右移动，加负数意味着从起点向左移动。

sections.title: Subtracting Integers
sections.explanation:
KEY RULE: Subtracting a number is the same as adding its opposite (additive inverse).

Examples:
• 5 - 8 = 5 + (-8) = -3
• 3 - (-7) = 3 + (+7) = 10
• (-4) - 6 = (-4) + (-6) = -10
• (-2) - (-5) = (-2) + (+5) = 3

Memory trick: "Subtracting is adding the opposite" - change the subtraction to addition and flip the sign of the second number.

sections.title: Multiplying & Dividing Integers
sections.content:
Sign Rules for Multiplication and Division:

1. SAME SIGNS → POSITIVE result
   • (+) × (+) = (+)    Example: 5 × 3 = 15
   • (-) × (-) = (+)    Example: (-5) × (-3) = 15
   • (+) ÷ (+) = (+)    Example: 20 ÷ 4 = 5
   • (-) ÷ (-) = (+)    Example: (-20) ÷ (-4) = 5

2. DIFFERENT SIGNS → NEGATIVE result
   • (+) × (-) = (-)    Example: 5 × (-3) = -15
   • (-) × (+) = (-)    Example: (-5) × 3 = -15
   • (+) ÷ (-) = (-)    Example: 20 ÷ (-4) = -5
   • (-) ÷ (+) = (-)    Example: (-20) ÷ 4 = -5

Memory trick: "Even number of negatives = Positive, Odd number of negatives = Negative"
Example: (-2) × (-3) × (-4) = -24 (three negatives = odd = negative result)

sections.title: Rational Numbers
sections.content:
A rational number is any number that can be expressed as a fraction p/q where:
• p and q are integers
• q ≠ 0 (denominator cannot be zero)

Types of Rational Numbers:

1. INTEGERS: All integers are rational (can write as fraction over 1)
   • 5 = 5/1
   • -3 = -3/1
   • 0 = 0/1

2. TERMINATING DECIMALS: Decimals that end
   • 0.5 = 1/2
   • 0.75 = 3/4
   • 2.8 = 28/10 = 14/5

3. REPEATING DECIMALS: Decimals with repeating pattern
   • 0.333... = 1/3
   • 0.666... = 2/3
   • 0.142857142857... = 1/7

NOTE: Numbers like √2, π, √3 are NOT rational (they are irrational) because they cannot be expressed as p/q.
sections.content_zh:
有理数是可以表示为分数p/q的任何数，其中：
• p和q是整数
• q ≠ 0（分母不能为零）

有理数的类型：

1. 整数：所有整数都是有理数（可以写成分数除以1）
   • 5 = 5/1
   • -3 = -3/1
   • 0 = 0/1

2. 有限小数：有结束的小数
   • 0.5 = 1/2
   • 0.75 = 3/4
   • 2.8 = 28/10 = 14/5

3. 循环小数：具有重复模式的小数
   • 0.333... = 1/3
   • 0.666... = 2/3
   • 0.142857142857... = 1/7

注意：像√2、π、√3这样的数不是有理数（它们是无理数），因为它们不能表示为p/q。

sections.title: Converting Between Forms
sections.content:
CONVERSION METHODS:

1. FRACTION → DECIMAL
   Divide numerator by denominator
   • 3/4 = 3 ÷ 4 = 0.75
   • 5/8 = 5 ÷ 8 = 0.625

2. DECIMAL → FRACTION
   • Count decimal places
   • Write as fraction over power of 10
   • Simplify
   Example: 0.6 = 6/10 = 3/5
   Example: 0.125 = 125/1000 = 1/8

3. FRACTION → PERCENTAGE
   Convert to decimal, then multiply by 100
   • 3/4 = 0.75 = 75%
   • 2/5 = 0.4 = 40%

4. PERCENTAGE → FRACTION
   Write as fraction over 100, then simplify
   • 30% = 30/100 = 3/10
   • 75% = 75/100 = 3/4

5. DECIMAL → PERCENTAGE
   Multiply by 100 and add % symbol
   • 0.85 = 85%
   • 0.3 = 30%

6. PERCENTAGE → DECIMAL
   Divide by 100
   • 45% = 45 ÷ 100 = 0.45
   • 8% = 8 ÷ 100 = 0.08

exercises.hint: Different signs: subtract smaller from larger (12 - 7 = 5), take sign of larger number (+).
exercises.hint_zh: 异号：从较大的减去较小的（12 - 7 = 5），取较大数字的符号（+）。
exercises.explanation: (-7) + 12 = +5. Since signs are different, we subtract: 12 - 7 = 5, and keep the sign of 12 which is positive.
exercises.explanation_zh: (-7) + 12 = +5。因为符号不同，我们做减法：12 - 7 = 5，并保留12的符号，即正号。

exercises.hint: Use the rule: a - b = a + (-b). So (-5) - (-8) = (-5) + 8
exercises.explanation: (-5) - (-8) = (-5) + 8 = 3. Subtracting negative 8 is the same as adding positive 8.

exercises.hint: Same signs multiply to give positive result. Negative × Negative = Positive.
exercises.hint_zh: 同号相乘得正数。负数×负数=正数。
exercises.explanation: (-3) × (-6) = 18. Two negative numbers multiplied together give a positive result.

exercises.hint: Different signs divide to give negative result. Negative ÷ Positive = Negative.
exercises.hint_zh: 异号相除得负数。负数÷正数=负数。
exercises.explanation: (-24) ÷ 6 = -4. Negative divided by positive gives negative.

exercises.prompt: Express 0.75 as a fraction in simplest form.
exercises.prompt_zh: 将0.75表示为最简分数形式。
exercises.hint: 0.75 has 2 decimal places, so write as 75/100, then simplify by dividing both by 25.
exercises.hint_zh: 0.75有2位小数，所以写成75/100，然后将分子和分母都除以25来简化。

exercises.hint: First convert to decimal: 2 ÷ 5 = 0.4, then multiply by 100 to get percentage.
exercises.hint_zh: 首先转换为小数：2 ÷ 5 = 0.4，然后乘以100得到百分数。

exercises.prompt: Convert 65% to a fraction in simplest form.
exercises.prompt_zh: 将65%转换为最简分数形式。

exercises.hint: Negative numbers are smaller than positive. Among negatives, -2 is smaller than -0.5.
exercises.hint_zh: 负数小于正数。在负数中，-2小于-0.5。
exercises.explanation: On the number line from left to right: -2, -0.5, 0.5, 1.5

exercises.hint: Think: can any integer be written as a fraction p/q?
exercises.hint_zh: 想想：任何整数都可以写成分数p/q吗？
exercises.explanation: All integers can be written as fractions (e.g., 5 = 5/1), so all integers ARE rational numbers. But not all rational numbers are integers (e.g., 1/2 is rational but not an integer).
exercises.explanation_zh: 所有整数都可以写成分数（例如，5 = 5/1），所以所有整数都是有理数。但不是所有有理数都是整数（例如，1/2是有理数但不是整数）。

exercises.hint: Work left to right: (-3 + 7) = 4, then (4 - 5) = -1, then (-1 + 2) = 1

exercises.prompt: The temperature was -3°C in the morning. It rose by 8°C by afternoon. What is the afternoon temperature?
exercises.prompt_zh: 早上温度是-3°C。到下午上升了8°C。下午的温度是多少？
exercises.explanation: Starting temperature: -3°C. Rose by 8°C means add 8: (-3) + 8 = 5°C
exercises.explanation_zh: 起始温度：-3°C。上升8°C意味着加8：(-3) + 8 = 5°C

exercises.prompt: Match each number with its equivalent form:
exercises.prompt_zh: 将每个数字与其等效形式匹配：
exercises.hint: Convert each to the same form (e.g., all to decimals) to compare.
exercises.hint_zh: 将每个转换为相同形式（例如，全部转换为小数）进行比较。
